question: General insurance contracts provide cover against the following risks, EXCEPT:
______________ buy insurance products.
In the context of the insurance market, insurance intermediaries are

options.A: real estate agents and property developers
options.B: insurance brokers, agents and financial advisers
options.D: motor franchise holders and stock brokers

question: Conventional insurance does not conform to Syariah rules and requirements because of involvement of the following elements, EXCEPT:

options.A: Maisir - gambling as the consequence of the presence of uncertainty
options.B: Riba - the existence of interest or usury in its investment activities
options.C: Gharar - uncertainty in the contract of insurance
options.D: Mudharabah - a contract whereby both parties agree on a profit and loss sharing

question: An example of a fundamental risk is

options.A: a road accident causing loss, injury and death to several motorists
options.B: a stock market crash causing heavy financial loss to investors
options.C: fire destroying a row of shop houses causing severe damage
options.D: a pandemic causing many communities in a region to shutdown

question: It is not acceptable to insure against the payment of fines or penalties imposed for contravening the law because

options.D: of the exclusion in the contract

question: The government and society as a whole are solely responsible for this type of risks:
Select the statement that is true of “Risk Control”

options.A: Minor loss can be retained by an organization
options.B: Risk can be avoided by not participating in the particular activity that gives rise to the risk
options.C: Risk of severe losses can be mitigated with adequate disaster recovery plans
options.D: Risk can be prevented with implementation of prudent risk management

question: In insurance, the transfer of rights and liabilities of the insured to a new insured is referred to as _________________
In a life proposal where age is a material fact, _______________ is required to avoid a misrepresentation by the proposer.
The requirement of insurable interest is merely to ensure that insurance is not abused for the purpose of speculation, wagering or______________.
_________________ are the subject matter of insurance in a life or personal accident policy.
In the absence of any specific questions in the proposal form, an insured is not required to disclose a fact that _________________

options.A: increases the risk to the insurer
options.B: diminishes the risk to the insurer
options.C: affects insurer’s rating of the risk
options.D: influences the decision in acceptance of the risk

question: Proximate cause is a key principle of insurance and is concerned with how the loss or damage actually occurred and whether it is a direct result of_________________

A mountain climber broke his leg and was hospitalized but died in hospital due to SARS contracted from another patient. The insurer will decline the death claim under his personal accident policy due to the application of the principle of
Consumers are required to submit their complaints to Financial Mediation Bureau within _________________ from the date of the final decision of the financial service provider.
Members of the Financial Mediation Bureau do NOT include
Identify which of the following are NOT covered by the provisions of Perbadanan Insurans Deposit Malaysia (PIDM).
An insurance company can be wound up

options.B: by filing an application to the high court
options.C: voluntarily by applying to the Companies Commission of Malaysia
options.D: by getting the prior written approval of Bank Negara Malaysia

question: Insurance companies in Malaysia are required to be incorporated as
Insurance companies must _________________ in respect of Customer Due Diligence under the Anti Money Laundering and Counter Financing of Terrorism compliance guidelines.

options.A: implement risk management commensurate with the level of money laundering and terrorism financing risks
options.B: report all cash transactions exceeding RM50,000 to Bank Negara Malaysia
options.C: submit a report on any suspicious transaction to Bank Negara Malaysia
options.D: verify and be satisfied with the identity of the customer or beneficial owner through reliable documentation when establishing business relationships

question: In the context of insurance, an ‘offer’ is made by the________________ when submitting a completed and signed proposal form to the insurer.
A key characteristic for a contract to be considered legally binding is the

options.A: intention to create a legal relationship
options.B: seal and stamp on the written document
options.C: mutual agreement arising out of goodwill
options.D: freedom to contract by all parties

question: There must be ‘consensus ad idem’ or ‘meeting of the minds’ in the formation of an insurance contract; otherwise, the contract would be deemed ______________.

Life Insurance contracts are subject to some formal rules as required by the Financial Services Act 2013. Schedule 8 (2) provides for ‘objection to life policy’ by the insured within 15 days after the delivery of the policy document. This period is referred to as the
A fundamental condition under a life insurance contract is __________________ before assumption of risk by the insurer.
_____________ is a legal contract creating a fiduciary relationship whereby the principal agrees that the actions of the agent bind the principal.
When an agency and principal relationship is formed retrospectively, this type of relationship is referred to as agency by
In Malaysia, insurance agencies are created

options.A: only through appointment by express agreement
options.B: through the creation of agency of necessity

question: The following does NOT reflect an act of good faith on the part of an agent when dealing with the principal:

options.B: Acting for his own personal interests at all times

question: In addition to paying the agreed commissions, a principal must reimburse the agent any money expended in the course of carrying out his duties. This is called the agent’s right to______________.
Which of the following is NOT a benefit provided by medical and health Insurance?

options.A: Lump sum payment on accidental death
options.B: Lump sum payment for critical illness
options.D: Payment of an allowance or income stream

question: Identify the benefits provided by a hospital and surgical insurance policy

options.A: Payment of the sum assured on permanent total disablement or death
options.C: Lump sum payment up diagnosis of a critical illness
options.D: Stream of income for the period of temporary disablement

question: Which of the following is NOT a medical and health insurance product?

options.C: Critical illness or dread disease insurance

question: Age and gender are important considerations in medical and health insurance and females have a higher rate of______________ as compared to their male counterparts.

Bank Negara Malaysia has issued Guidelines on Medical and Health Insurance Business, and Guidelines on Product Transparency and Disclosure to
I. increase competition among private health care providers
II. reduce mis-selling and misrepresentation to consumers
III. enhance access to healthcare through private insurance
IV. contain costs to promote long-term sustainability of the private health insurance sector
Identify the risk category under medical and health insurance that will be imposed special terms, higher premiums or limitations in coverage or both
________________ is NOT a method of policy limitation applied to hospital and surgical insurance policies in order to contain rising claims cost.
Which of the following will NOT terminate a policy?

options.B: On the policy anniversary date following the insured’s maximum eligibility age
options.C: Exhaustion of the annual limit or lifetime limit stipulated
options.D: Sudden disappearance of insured for 5 years

question: Occupational hazard increases the chance of work-related injuries and diseases which in turn affect the premium rates, particularly for
A ______________ if known by the insurer, would lead to the refusal to issue a life policy on the life proposed.
An employer has insurable interest in the life of a key employee (shareholder or partner) whose ______________ could adversely affect the sustainability of the business.
Select from the following what a life insurer would do if, after the policy has been in force for three years, it is found the life insured’s age is different from what was stated in the life policy.

options.A: The life insurer will terminate the policy
options.B: The life insurer will vary sum assured, premium and bonuses to reflect the actual age
options.C: The life insurer will charge the life assured in court
options.D: The life insurer will take no action

question: Identify when insurable interest needs to be present.

options.A: Before the death of the life assured
options.B: At the inception of the policy
options.C: During the death of the life assured
options.D: At the maturity of the policy

question: Policyholder Mr A decides to surrender his standard life policy after 4 years. He has no outstanding premium and the policy is in force. The surrender value he is entitled to is

options.A: a sum allocated towards savings and the earnings less a surrender charge
options.B: a sum allocated towards savings and earnings and with no other charges deducted
options.C: the total sum assured with no deductions
options.D: a sum allocated towards savings less a surrender charge

question: Policy monies payable under a life policy or monies payable on the surrender of a life policy shall be paid

options.A: without the consent of persons entitled
options.B: only upon death or maturity of the policy
options.C: less deduction for the medical expenses
options.D: without any deduction for monies not due under the policy

question: With regard to a life insurance proposal, _________________ is a material fact which, if known by the insurer, would have been declined, imposed higher premium loadings or limited policy coverage.

If a policy owner wants to surrender a life policy, the life insurance company will determine the surrender value entitlement
I. in accordance with generally accepted actuarial principles
II. in a manner ensuring fair treatment of the policy owner
III. in compliance with standards of business conduct
IV. in accordance with LIFO and FIFO principles
The main purpose of life insurance is to provide________________ for dependents.
______________ insurance is the earliest and simplest form of life insurance for a fixed term or period and is not permanent.
Non-participating life policyholders have no right to share in the ________________ of the insurer’s life insurance fund.
_______________ is/are the investments that a life office has made from the premiums it has received after meeting its outgoes in the form of claims and expenses.
Group term life insurance is a benefit frequently offered by employers either on a contributory or non-contributory basis. ‘Non-contributory basis’ means premiums are
Which of the following statements best describes the investment-linked life insurance policy?

options.B: Protection for the whole of life

question: In planning for his retirement, Tom purchased a deferred annuity which guaranteed him a stream of income after retirement. Unfortunately, Tom died midway through the 10-year contribution period. The premiums paid by Tom will be

options.B: deferred to the next of kin or estate
options.C: converted to an automatic premium loan
options.D: considered as earned by the insurer

question: The eligibility criteria to automatically add new employees to a group life policy from the date of recruitment is:

options.A: All employees selected by an internal recruitment process
options.B: Healthy employees under a contract of service regardless of age
options.C: Permanent employees between the ages of 16 and 60
options.D: Permanent and temporary workers with valid work permits

question: The term “level premium system” as applied to life insurance contracts means premiums are

options.A: increased to commensurate with the increase in the amount of benefits
options.B: lower initially and then level off at the end of the contract
options.C: guaranteed to remain the same throughout the contract
options.D: levelled to reflect the increase in the risk as policy matures

question: Group life insurance premium is calculated differently compared to individual life insurance premium. It is
Identify why although life insurance companies use the same factors to determine premium rates, premiums differ.

options.A: Because of different asset valuation methods and provisions for liabilities
options.B: Because of different capital reserve structures and investment methods
options.C: Because of different cost structures, assessment of risk and investment returns
options.D: Because of different distribution channels, branding and target markets
